fields.value: Code Appendix for: The Effect of Mercosur on the Marketing of New Products

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This article uses a database with a high level of disaggregation in order to measure
the impact of Mercosur on the improvement of the new business relationships. So
that, it will consider the extensive margin definition of trade developed by Baldwin
& Di Nino (2008), namely: the number of products that did not belong to export products
before signing the bilateral agreement. The results indicate that Mercosur has
a positive impact on the probability of a new class of product to be traded (around
1.87%). It was also noted that Paraguay and Uruguay were the most benefit countries
with the agreement.

publicationCitation.value: Figueiredo, Erik; Loures, Alexandre. "O Efeito do Mercosul Sobre a Comercialização de Novos Produtos". Revista Brasileira de Economia. Rio de Janeiro, 70 (3), 305-314, 2016.

fields.value: Since the bases on international trade do not report trade flows equal to zero. This routine aims to expand the trade base by generating trade flows equal to zero, thus allowing an analysis of the impact of the Regional Trade Agreements (RTAs) on the creation of new markets.

files.description: Computational routine in R to analyze the impact of Mercosur on the intensive and extensive margins of international trade. In fact, this routine generates trade flows equal to zero since the bases on international trade report positive trade, that is, non-zero. This routine was used in the article: "O Efeito do Mercosul Sobre a Comercialização de Novos Produtos". - Revista Brasileira de Economia. Rio de Janeiro, 70 (3), 305-314, 2016.
files.label: expand-mercosur.R

dataFile.description: Computational routine in R to analyze the impact of Mercosur on the intensive and extensive margins of international trade. In fact, this routine generates trade flows equal to zero since the bases on international trade report positive trade, that is, non-zero. This routine was used in the article: "O Efeito do Mercosul Sobre a Comercialização de Novos Produtos". - Revista Brasileira de Economia. Rio de Janeiro, 70 (3), 305-314, 2016.
